repnme.cdata!:
Niger - Institutional Strengthening and
            Health Sector Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Institutional
            Strengthening and Health Sector Support Project for Niger
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: sector-wide approaches need
            to carefully balance expectations and forward momentum.
            Though good governance, continuity, and sustained commitment
            of both the ministry and its partners are necessary
            conditions for a successful sector-wide approach, they are
            not sufficient. While the financial resources allocated by
            the common fund were important, equally so were the
            flexibility and decentralized procedures which accompanied
            these resources.

6697812.trustfund:
TF053735-PHRD-NIGER: HEALTH SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (HEALTH III)

repnme.cdata!:
Niger - Institutional Strengthening and
            Health Sector Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Niger Institutional Strengthening
            and Health Sector Support Project will focus on addressing
            major institutional and organizational bottlenecks which
            prevent achievement of the Millennium Development Goals and
            will, through three components, support the Ministry of
            Health in: (a) strengthening the strategy of human resources
            management; (b) improving essential drugs and medical
            supplies management strategy; (c) strengthening major public
            health programs (Reproductive health, Malaria, nutrition,
            etc.) and improving quality of services; (d) improving
            demand, accessibility and utilization; (e) strengthening
            governance and institutional capacity, including capacity
            for safe medical waste management; (f) ensuring adequate and
            equitable financing; (8) improving community participation;
            and (h) implementing appropriate monitoring and evaluation
            mechanisms regarding program performance and ensuring good
            donor coordination. The three project components finance: 1)
            Human resources development and management;  2) Expansion of
            services and delivery of minimum health package (MHP) with
            three sub-components that improve essential drugs and
            medical supplies management; strengthen health programs and
            improve qualitv of services; and improve health care demand
            and accessibility; 3) Strengthening governance and
            institutional capacity, with four sub-components that
            strengthen health management and institutional capacity;
            improve equitable financing of the health svstem; improve
            community participation; and fund monitoring and evaluation.
